title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: interest fostering open welcoming environment, contributors maintainers pledge making participation project community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity expression, level experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying standards acceptable behavior expected take appropriate fair corrective action response instances unacceptable behavior. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Examples representing project community include using official project e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event. Representation project may defined clarified project maintainers.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project team rdataretriever@weecology.org. project team review investigate complaints, respond way deems appropriate circumstances. project team obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. details specific enforcement policies may posted separately. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct good faith may face temporary permanent repercussions determined members project’s leadership.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4

title: Using the rdataretriever to quickly analyze Breeding Bird Survey data
text: Breeding Bird Survey North America (BBS) widely used dataset understanding geospatial variation dynamic changes bird communities. dataset continental scale community science project thousands birders count birds locations across North America. used hundreds research projects including research biodiversity gradients (Hurlbert Haskell 2003), ecological forecasting (Harris, Taylor, White 2018), bird declines (Rosenberg et al. 2019). However working Breeding Bird Survey data can challenging composed roughly 100 different files need cleaned combined multiple ways. initial phases data analysis pipeline can require hours work even experienced users understand detailed layout data either manually assemble write code combine data. data structure location also changes regularly meaning code work regularly tested quickly stops working. vignette demonstrates using rdataretriever can eliminate hours work data cleaning restructing allowing researchers quickly begin addressing interesting scientific questions. demonstrates analyzing BBS data evaluate correlates biodiversity (form species richness).

title: Using the rdataretriever to quickly analyze Breeding Bird Survey data
text: start loading necessary packages. addition rdataretriever demo ’ll also use DBI, RSQLite dplyr work data, raster working environmental data, ggplot2 visualization.
code: library(rdataretriever) library(DBI) library(dplyr) library(dbplyr) library(raster) library(ggplot2)

what: Install And Connect To The Breeding Bird Survey Data
title: Using the rdataretriever to quickly analyze Breeding Bird Survey data
text: First ’ll update rdataretriever make sure newest data processing recipes case something structure location dataset changed. Centrally updated data recipes reproducible research dataset something changes every year newest data released meaning custom code processing data stops working. happens retriever recipe updated running get_updates() data analysis code continues run always . Next install BBS data SQLite database named bbs.sqlite. also load data straight R (using rdataretriever::fetch('breed-bird-survey')), store flat files (CSV, JSON, XML), load database management systems (PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MySQL). data moderately large (~1GB) SQLite represents nice compromise efficiently conducting first steps data manipulation pipeline requiring additional setup expertise. large number storage backends makes rdataretriever easy integrate existing data processing workflows implement designs appropriate scale data additional work. installed data SQLite can connect database start analyzing data. two key tables analysis surveys sites tables, let’s create connections tables. surveys table holds data many individuals species sampled site. sites table holds information site ’ll use link data environmental variables.
code: bbs_db <- dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), 'bbs.sqlite') surveys <- tbl(bbs_db, "breed_bird_survey_counts") sites <- tbl(bbs_db, "breed_bird_survey_routes")

title: Using the rdataretriever to quickly analyze Breeding Bird Survey data
text: calculate measure biodiversity, species richness number species, ’ll use dplyr determine number species observed site recent year. data now smaller original ~1 GB, used collect load summarized data directly R. Next need get environmental data site, ’ll get worldclim dataset. extract environmental data first make sites data spatial add map. can extract environmental data site bioclim raster add data biodiversity. Now let’s see richness relates precipitation. Annual precipition stored bio12. looks like ’s pattern , let’s fit smoother . shows low bird biodiversity really dry areas, biodiversity peaks intermediate precipitations, drops highest precipitation values. wanted use kind information inform conservation decisions state level, look patterns within state filtering ensure enough data points. Looking back demo one line code directly involving rdataretriever (installation). demonstrates strength rdataretriever brings early phases data acquistion processing pipeline distilling steps single line provides data ready--analyze form researchers can focus analysis data .
code: rich_data <- surveys %>%   filter(year == 2016) %>%   group_by(statenum, route) %>%   summarize(richness = n()) %>%   collect() rich_data bioclim <- getData('worldclim', var = 'bio', res = 10) sites <- as.data.frame(sites) sites_spatial <- SpatialPointsDataFrame(sites[c('longitude', 'latitude')], sites) bioclim_bbs <- extract(bioclim, sites_spatial) %>%   cbind(sites) richness_w_env <- inner_join(rich_data, bioclim_bbs) richness_w_env ggplot(richness_w_env, aes(x = bio12, y = richness)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.5) +   labs(x = "Annual Precipitation", y = "Number of Species") ggplot(richness_w_env, aes(x = bio12, y = richness)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.5) +   geom_smooth() richness_w_env_high_n <- richness_w_env %>%   group_by(statenum) %>%   filter(n() >= 50)  ggplot(richness_w_env_high_n, aes(x = bio12, y = richness)) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth() +   facet_wrap(~statenum, scales = 'free') +   labs(x = "Annual Precipitation", y = "Number of Species")

title: Using the rdataretriever to quickly analyze Breeding Bird Survey data
text: Thanks rdataretriever can generate meaningful information large scale bird biodiversity patterns 15 minutes. ’d working raw BBS data likely spent hours manipulating cleaning data start analysis.

what: R Interface to the Data Retriever
title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: R interface Data Retriever. rdataretriever provides access cleaned versions hundreds commonly used public datasets single line code. datasets come many different sources require cleaning restructuring prior analysis. rdataretriever uses set actively maintained recipes downloading, cleaning, restructing datasets using combination Frictionless Data Specification custom data cleaning scripts. rdataretriever also facilitates automatic storage datasets choice database management systems (PostgreSQL, SQLite, MySQL, MariaDB) flat file formats (CSV, XML, JSON) later use integration large data analysis pipelines. rdatretriever also facilitates reproducibile science providing tools archive rerun precise version dataset associated cleaning steps used specific analysis. rdataretriever handles work cleaning, storing, archiving data can focus analysis, inference visualization.

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: Basic Installation (Python experience needed) Advanced Installation Python Users Installing Tabular Datasets Installing Spatial Datasets Using Docker Containers Provenance Acknowledgements

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: rdataretriever R wrapper Python package, Data Retriever. means Python retriever Python package need installed first.

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: just want use Data Retriever within R follow instuctions run following commands R. create local Python installation used R install needed Python package . running commands restart R.
code: install.packages('reticulate') # Install R package for interacting with Python reticulate::install_miniconda() # Install Python reticulate::py_install('retriever') # Install the Python retriever package install.packages('rdataretriever') # Install the R package for running the retriever rdataretriever::get_updates() # Update the available datasets

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: using Python tasks can use rdataretriever existing Python installation (though basic installation also work case creating separate miniconda install Python environment).

previous_headings: Installation > Advanced Installation for Python Users
title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
code: install.packages("rdataretriever") # latest release from CRAN remotes::install_github("ropensci/rdataretriever") # development version from GitHub

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
code: library(rdataretriever)  # List the datasets available via the Retriever rdataretriever::datasets()  # Install the portal into csv files in your working directory rdataretriever::install_csv('portal')  # Download the raw portal dataset files without any processing to the # subdirectory named data rdataretriever::download('portal', './data/')  # Install and load a dataset as a list portal = rdataretriever::fetch('portal') names(portal) head(portal$species)

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: Set-Requirements Tools PostgreSQL PostGis, psql(client), raster2pgsql, shp2pgsql, gdal, rdataretriever supports installation spatial data Postgres DBMS. Install PostgreSQL PostGis install PostgreSQL PostGis use spatial data please refer OSGeo Postgres installation instructions. recommend storing PostgreSQL login information .pgpass file avoid supplying password every time. See .pgpass documentation details. installation, Make sure paths tools added system’s PATHS. Please consult operating system expert help change add PATH variables. example, sample paths exported Mac: Enable PostGIS extensions Postgres set , enable PostGIS extensions. done using either Postgres CLI GUI(PgAdmin) run psql CLI shell  psql -d yourdatabase -c "CREATE EXTENSION postgis;"  psql -d yourdatabase -c "CREATE EXTENSION postgis_topology;" GUI(PgAdmin) details refer PostGIS docs. Sample commands
code: #~/.bash_profile file, Postgres PATHS and tools. export PATH="/Applications/Postgres.app/Contents/MacOS/bin:${PATH}" export PATH="$PATH:/Applications/Postgres.app/Contents/Versions/10/bin" CREATE EXTENSION postgis; CREATE EXTENSION postgis_topology rdataretriever::install_postgres('harvard-forest') # Vector data rdataretriever::install_postgres('bioclim') # Raster data  # Install only the data of USGS elevation in the given extent rdataretriever::install_postgres('usgs-elevation', list(-94.98704597353938, 39.027001800158615, -94.3599408119917, 40.69577051867074))

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: ensure reproducibility rdataretriever supports creating snapshots data script time. Use commit function create store snapshot image data time. Provide descriptive message created commit. comparable git commit, however function bundles data scripts used backup. provenace, able reproduce analysis future. Commit dataset default commits stored provenance directory .retriever_provenance, directory can changed setting environment variable PROVENANCE_DIR. can also set path individual commit: View log committed datasets provenance directory Install committed dataset reanalyze committed dataset, rdataretriever obtain data script history rdataretriever install particular data given back-end. example, SQLite: Datasets stored provenance directory can installed directly using hash value
code: rdataretriever::commit('abalone-age',                        commit_message='A snapshot of Abalone Dataset as of 2020-02-26') rdataretriever::commit('abalone-age',                        commit_message='Data and recipe archive for Abalone Data on 2020-02-26',                        path='.') rdataretriever::commit_log('abalone-age') rdataretriever::install_sqlite('abalone-age-a76e77.zip') rdataretriever::install_sqlite('abalone-age', hash_value='a76e77')

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: run image interactively docker-compose run --service-ports rdata /bin/bash run tests docker-compose  run rdata Rscript load_and_test.R

title: R Interface to the Data Retriever
text: Make sure tests passing R-oldrelease, current R-release R-devel check package Test get citation information rdataretriever R use citation(package = 'rdataretriever')
code: R CMD Build #build the package R CMD check  --as-cran --no-manual rdataretriever_[version]tar.gz setwd("./rdataretriever") # Set working directory # install all deps # install.packages("reticulate") library(DBI) library(RPostgreSQL) library(RSQLite) library(reticulate) library(RMariaDB) install.packages(".", repos = NULL, type="source") roxygen2::roxygenise() devtools::test()

rdataretriever 3.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-18

title: rdataretriever 3.1.0
text: Add rdatasets Socrata API Remove Travis use GitHub actions Change default branch master main Add Joss Paper DOI badge Update simplify installation instructions Remove windows specific install instructions Update vignettes

title: rdataretriever 3.1.0
text: Rename function data_retriever_version Add get_version function Automatically reload scripts Reactivate MariaDB tests Use Cloud CRAN mirror Docker-based testing Simplify interface retriever module add function install retriever Add tests get-script-citation Add get citation function

title: rdataretriever 3.0.1
text: welcome Apoorva Pandey Hao Ye coauthors package. Thanks great contributions!

title: rdataretriever 3.0.1
text: Add provenance support Add support new online/offline dataset feature retriever Automatically update dataset status Check retriever Python package sufficiently --date Update simplify installation instructions Add get citation function Update simplify internals benefit updates reticulate Add vignettes ## Minor Improvements Improvements code style documentation Use Cloud CRAN mirror Docker-based testing stability Add get_version function, returns version Data Retriever

title: rdataretriever 1.1.0
text: NEW COAUTHORS welcome Pranita Sharma David J. Harris coauthors package. Thanks great help Pranita David! NEW FEATURES Use reticulate integrate retriever Python Spatial dataset processing Beta version using PostGis MINOR IMPROVEMENTS Use Docker compose testing Switch Python 3 testing Enhance path search Windows Add debug script reporting environment variables Update documentation match latest version Add license file

title: rdataretriever 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-03-11 NEW PACKAGE NAME EcoData Retriever renamed Data Retriever reflect utility outside ecological data consequently renamed R package ecoretriever rdataretriever NEW COAUTHORS welcome Henry Senyondo Shawn Taylor coauthors package. Thanks great help Henry Shawn! NEW FEATURES Add reset allows user delete Data Retriever downloaded files Add json xml output options MINOR IMPROVEMENTS Accommodate new retriever naming conventions fetch Don’t change class return update log Specify documentation functions internal use. Change dataset names source README.md BUG FIXES Search Anaconda installs Data Retriever Obtain correct home path RStudio Windows
